issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Need ability to add/remove/reposition tiles on dash.  (reposition done previously)
fields.summary: Add ability to add/remove tiles on the dashboard

comments.body:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1035

check it out! Might need minor style tweaks.

Hey [~dkavanagh], I get a waitress error when i try and view the dash now. Here's what the cli shows, hope this helps:

2014-10-10 16:52:48,700 ERROR [waitress][Dummy-3] Exception when serving /
Traceback (most recent call last):

    app_iter = self.channel.server.application(env, start_response)

    response = handle_request(request)

    response = handler(request)
  File "/Users/jloza/sites/eucaconsole/eucaconsole/tweens.py", line 42, in tween

  File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/pyramid-1.5a2-py2.7.egg/pyramid/router.py", line 163, in handle_request
    response = view_callable(context, request)
  File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/pyramid-1.5a2-py2.7.egg/pyramid/config/views.py", line 322, in attr_view
    return view(context, request)
  File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/pyramid-1.5a2-py2.7.egg/pyramid/config/views.py", line 298, in predicate_wrapper

    response = getattr(inst, attr)()
  File "/Users/jloza/sites/eucaconsole/eucaconsole/views/dashboard.py", line 66, in dashboard_home
    tiles_not_shown.remove('accounts')
ValueError: list.remove(x): x not in list
I assigned it back to you because I pushed a fix.
Oh, sorry, didn't realize, thought maybe I had just commented but not moved ticket! Thanks, will review.

Awesome job, [~dkavanagh]! YAY!

Small things:

* Please make the options in the dropdown match the titles of the tiles. For example, "Running instances" instead of "instances-running: (done)
* Please be sure dropdown options are sentence case (done)
* should not have IAM-related options in dropdown when logged in to AWS (done)
* When there's no tiles to add, should hide the "Add a tile" tile all together. Only display it when tiles have been removed. (done)
* I'm not so worried about the "undo" growl on removal, i think it's fine without, they can always add tile. Don't worry about that even though it's in the wireframe.

I hadn't noticed the "undo" growl. glad we can avoid it since we don't have any other growls with a link in it (that I'm aware of).
I'll fix the rest. I wondered about the 1st thing, but it's more work... I'll think about how to do that cleverly that doesn't require me to define the names all over (aside from where they already are in the tiles).
[~jloza], [~dkavanagh]: Could we update the title of this ticket to be more specific?  Perhaps replace the title with what's currently in the description?
[~kgill], if you feel strongly about the title being more accurate, simply change it.
[~dkavanagh]: I would, but I want to confirm with you and [~jloza] about the scope of this ticket.  Is it only referring to adding/removing tiles on the dashboard?
Thank you for updating the title, [~dkavanagh].  Does the scope of this ticket include building a tile to display a log of recent actions, as indicated in the ticket description?
submitting for code review since Jenny is traveling. Hopefully, we can get this merged into develop ASAP for the sprint demo and if there are further UX concerns, address those later.
[~dkavanagh]: PR 1035 looks good to merge, although the Jenkins build has failed.  I've restarted the build, and feel free to merge the PR if it passes.

AFAIK, it's passed: http://10.111.4.12/job/Eucalyptus%20Console%20Pull%20Request%20Monitor/1067/
I think I know why it showed a failure in github. I had pushed a tweak to use an entity for a > symbol. I killed the CI build for that push and let the earlier one continue. The earlier one (linked) passed but the later one wasn't showing success, so I think that's what fed the github status.

Nice job! Just one small thing that I would have done myself, but I didn't see a style associated in your file, so kicking back to you. 

* "Reset tile display" font is gigante! Can you please make it the same size as the Create whatever links are inside the tiles? It draws the eye too it to much like it is.
ready to merge, just waiting on CI to build
UX review passed, merged to develop
